definition: forehead/horizontal tablet or inscribed board/specified number or amount

sentences.english: The divisions bonus pool is divvied up - in large part - on the basis of the rankings.
sentences.chinese: 部门的奖金总额很大程度上是按评估等级分配的。

sentences.english: Together, the five brands account for roughly half of all watch sales in China.
sentences.chinese: 上述五大手表品牌基本上占中国手表销售总额的一半。

sentences.english: MOTOROLA the 2005 global sales totaled $368 billion.
sentences.chinese: 摩托罗拉2005年的全球销售总额为368亿美元。

sentences.english: Nestlé sales for 2010 were almost CHF 110 bn.
sentences.chinese: 雀巢2010年销售总额将近110亿瑞士法郎。

sentences.english: Currently total wages accounts only 30% or so of national income.
sentences.chinese: 当前工资总额仅占国民收入的30%左右。

sentences.english: The total daily transfer limit for Hang Seng (China) Manned Phone Banking Service and Automated Phone Banking Services are shared.
sentences.chinese: 自动语音电话理财服务的日转账总额度为共享。

sentences.english: The treasurer decamped with part of the company's payroll.
sentences.chinese: 司库携公司工资总额之部分潜逃了。
你所定的比铲饼总额为170元。

sentences.english: Planning of 2019, total group sales exceed 10 billion yuan.
sentences.chinese: 规划2019年，集团销售总额突破百亿元。

sentences.english: I did not count the money. My mom told me the total amount.
sentences.chinese: 我没有数过有多少，每次都是我妈告诉我总额的。

sentences.english: Students wil be charged 35% of the Course fees for the exempted course.
sentences.chinese: 免修需按该门课学费总额的35%向学院缴纳免修费。

sentences.english: The salesperson rang up all my items and the total price came to 1000 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 售货员将全部商品结了账，总额共1000元。

sentences.english: But why do total assets equal the total of liabilities and owner's equity ?
sentences.chinese: 但是为什么资产总额等于负债加业主权益的总和呢？

sentences.english: Later today the two sides will sign economic and trade agreements worth about 10 billion U.
sentences.chinese: 今天还将签署总额约100亿美芫的经贸协议。

sentences.english: That was nearly three-quarters of the losses made by all Indian carriers combined.
sentences.chinese: 这几乎是印度所有航空公司亏损总额的四分之三。

sentences.english: The total comes to fifty-four dollars.

definition: to add up the total/to figure what sth amounts to/to consider
sum or volume of business transactions/turnover
to convert into/to amount to/to be equivalent to
